<Link id="l00158" /><CodeLine lineNumber="158"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Most PPC&#42; platforms are big endian, PPC(64)LE is little endian.</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00160" /><CodeLine lineNumber="160"><span class="doxyHighlight">    Ret = </span><span class="doxyHighlightStringLiteral">&quot;e&quot;</span><span class="doxyHighlight">;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00161" /><CodeLine lineNumber="161"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">else</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00163" /><CodeLine lineNumber="163"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00164" /><CodeLine lineNumber="164"><span class="doxyHighlight">  Ret += <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/datalayout/#a1c5b48c01700ee5c1d1a6df0fec2c72e">DataLayout::getManglingComponent</a>(<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/mips/mips16isellowering-cpp/#a0acb682b8260ab1c60b918599864e2e5">T</a>);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00165" /><CodeLine lineNumber="165"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00166" /><CodeLine lineNumber="166"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// PPC32 has 32 bit pointers. The PS3 (OS Lv2) is a PPC64 machine with 32 bit</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00168" /><CodeLine lineNumber="168"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">if</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (!<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/x86/lib/target/x86/disassembler/x86disassembler-cpp/#a652270ec0bdb03b5a7f934524412aa7f">is64Bit</a> || <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/mips/mips16isellowering-cpp/#a0acb682b8260ab1c60b918599864e2e5">T</a>.getOS() == <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/triple/#a3cfefc755ab656000934f91193afb1cda379ed41d00eaa4c446cdefc892d8762f">Triple::Lv2</a>)</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00169" /><CodeLine lineNumber="169"><span class="doxyHighlight">    Ret += </span><span class="doxyHighlightStringLiteral">&quot;-p:32:32&quot;</span><span class="doxyHighlight">;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00170" /><CodeLine lineNumber="170"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00171" /><CodeLine lineNumber="171"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// If the target ABI uses function descriptors, then the alignment of function</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00172" /><CodeLine lineNumber="172"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// pointers depends on the alignment used to emit the descriptor. Otherwise,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00173" /><CodeLine lineNumber="173"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// function pointers are aligned to 32 bits because the instructions must be.</span></CodeLine>
